definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: In other places, the coexistence continues.
sentences.chinese: 在其他地方，这种清音和浊音仍然共存。

sentences.english: The simulation results show that the proposed method can separate unvoiced and voiced signals.
sentences.chinese: 仿真结果表明，该方法可以分离清音和浊音信号。

sentences.english: Objective To study the feasibility of applying extrusion - puffing technique to the preparation of Qingyin Teabag .
sentences.chinese: 目的研究加压膨化工艺用于清音袋泡剂制备的可行性。

sentences.english: If the rain god lowered Ganlin, Fuze creatures convey the voiceless.
sentences.chinese: 雨如神仙降下的甘霖，传递着福泽众生的清音。

sentences.english: Learn pairs of consonants that are voiced and voiceless and practice through minimal pairs.
sentences.chinese: 将清音和浊音的辅音通过最小对立组进行成对练习。

sentences.english: Qingyin Pavilion is known as the second largest suspended temple on the Daciyan Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 清音阁被称作是大慈岩的第二悬空寺。

sentences.english: Originally expected to spend half an hour in Qingyin Pavilion , the results I only spent a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 本来预计在清音阁呆半小时，结果我只待了几分钟。

sentences.english: It is a Taoist temple, called Qingyin Pavilion.

definition: guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
